channel.title: Talks By Robert D. Hales
channel.description: General Conference talks by Robert D. Hales.

item.title: A Question of Free Agency
item.description: My brothers and sisters, this is indeed an occasion for me and my family. I would like to say to Brother Sill that I have listened to him all my life, and this is one time I wish he had never stopped.

item.title: We Can’t Do It Alone
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I am blessed to stand at this pulpit and feel the radiating spirit of those who have gone before over the past 108 years since the first conference was held in this building, and to feel the testimonies which have been borne

item.title: The Lord Offers Everyone a Way Back from Sin
item.description: I too would like to add my confirmation that this is a historic occasion and as a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy give support to the First Council, to the Quorum of the Twelve, and to any assignment they might ask us to do.

item.title: “What Think Ye of Christ?” “Whom Say Ye That I Am?”
item.description: I bring you greetings from the Saints and missionaries in the British Isles, especially those in the England London Mission where my dear companion, Mary, and I are currently serving.

item.title: Examples from the Life of a Prophet
item.description: Many of the examples used in the teachings of our Savior, Jesus Christ, were from everyday events which happened around him. In much the same way, modern-day prophets teach us by their daily example. The simple but powerful message is “Come, follow m

item.title: Your Sorrow Shall Be Turned to Joy
item.description: There are many kinds of sorrow and suffering:

item.title: The Mantle of a Bishop
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, this is the fourth time that I will be ordained or set apart as a bishop.

item.title: Lessons from the Atonement That Help Us to Endure to the End
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I believe in Christ, and I stand to be accountable for that testimony. I ask the Lord’s blessings this day for the sustaining support of my Brethren and for His support in Spirit.

item.title: Welfare Principles to Guide Our Lives: An Eternal Plan for the Welfare of Men’s Souls
item.description: My brothers and sisters, throughout the history of the world, the Lord has been concerned for the eternal welfare of the souls of his children. Over the past fifty years, inspired leaders have taught welfare principles to help us plan ahead for diffi

item.title: “Some Have Compassion, Making a Difference”
item.description: The people of each dispensation of time have received the teaching and admonition of living prophets to care for one another.

item.title: Making Righteous Choices at the Crossroads of Life
item.description: The scriptures teach us that an important part of mortal probation will be making the right choices. How do we make the right choices when there are so many temptations and so many people telling us what they think we should do with our lives?

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood: Return with Honor
item.description: My dear brethren, I appreciate the opportunity of speaking this evening as a bishop. I would like to talk about the Aaronic Priesthood—first, what it is not. It is not an activity; and second, it is not a priesthood in which we advance because of age

item.title: Gratitude for the Goodness of God
item.description: A few months ago I had an experience that took me to the very edge of this mortal existence. As many of you know, I suffered a heart attack last August. I had the opportunity of knowing firsthand of the healing strength that comes through united pray

item.title: How Will Our Children Remember Us?
item.description: My message today is one of love. I love my dear companion, Mary, my two sons, and their families. May I express appreciation for all the joy they have brought into my life.

item.title: The Unique Message of Jesus Christ
item.description: It is time for my response. Nineteen years ago, after my being set apart by the Quorum of the Twelve in the temple as an assistant to the Twelve Apostles, Elder LeGrand Richards gave me two pieces of wisdom that have come to me over and over in the p

item.title: The Importance of Receiving a Personal Testimony
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, this morning was a historic occasion. It was a great honor and privilege to join with you in a solemn assembly to sustain President Howard W. Hunter as prophet, seer, and revelator and President of The Church of Jesus

item.title: Hear the Prophet’s Voice and Obey
item.description: President Hinckley, President Monson, President Faust, as we raised our hands in the law of common consent during the solemn assembly, we gave our consecration, our love, and our devotion to our prophet, and we sustain the First Presidency.

item.title: Blessings of the Priesthood
item.description: A few weeks ago, I was in Santiago, Chile, participating in priesthood training meetings. In the Saturday meeting, we had a discussion about the importance of brethren receiving the priesthood after baptism. Early Sunday morning I was awakened with a

item.title: “If Thou Wilt Enter into Life, Keep the Commandments”
item.description: The Savior said, “If thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments” (). I would like to tell you a story, brethren—a true story about a man named Abinadi. Abinadi was a prophet who preached repentance to a wicked people and a wicked king. He preac

item.title: The Eternal Family
item.description: I wish to speak to all those who would like to know about eternal families and about families being forever. One year ago the First Presidency and Quorum of the Twelve Apostles of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints issued a proclamation

item.title: “When Thou Art Converted, Strengthen Thy Brethren”
item.description: To become one in the family of Saints requires established members of the Church to warmly welcome new members with open arms.

item.title: In Remembrance of Jesus
item.description: Jesus is the great Mediator. Through omnipotent and omniscient, all-powerful and all-knowing, He is our friend.

item.title: “Behold, We Count Them Happy Which Endure”
item.description: We cannot expect to learn endurance in our later years if we have developed the habit of quitting when things get difficult now.

item.title: Healing Soul and Body
item.description: If we seek the truth, develop faith in Him, and … sincerely repent, we will receive a spiritual change of heart which only comes from our Savior. Our hearts will become new again.

item.title: Strengthening Families: Our Sacred Duty
item.description: The key to strengthening our families is having the Spirit of the Lord come into our homes. The goal of our families is to be on the strait and narrow path.

item.title: The Covenant of Baptism: To Be in the Kingdom and of the Kingdom
item.description: Our Baptism and confirmation is the gateway into His kingdom. When we enter, we covenant to be of His kingdom—forever!

item.title: Couple Missionaries: A Time to Serve
item.description: It is proper for a mature sister or couple to let their priesthood leaders know that they are willing and able to serve a mission. I urge you to do so.

item.title: Fulfilling Our Duty to God
item.description: I promise you that your achievement of the Duty to God Award will provide you with a living testimony that will sustain you throughout your life.

item.title: Out of Darkness into His Marvelous Light
item.description: The emblems of the Savior’s Atonement remind us that we need not stumble in darkness. We can have His light with us always.

item.title: Tithing: A Test of Faith with Eternal Blessings
item.description: Pay your tithing. Unlock the windows of heaven. You will be abundantly blessed for your obedience and faithfulness to the Lord’s laws and commandments.

item.title: Faith through Tribulation Brings Peace and Joy
item.description: However dark conditions may seem in this world today, whatever the storms we are facing personally, … joy can be ours now.

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Restored Gospel of Jesus Christ
item.description: Follow the example of Joseph Smith and the pattern of the Restoration. Turn to the scriptures. Kneel in prayer. Ask in faith. Listen to the Holy Ghost.

item.title: With All the Feeling of a Tender Parent: A Message of Hope to Families
item.description: No matter how evil the world becomes, our families can be at peace. If we do what’s right, we will be guided and protected.

item.title: Finding Faith in the Lord Jesus Christ
item.description: Only faith in the Lord Jesus Christ and His Atonement can bring us peace, hope, and understanding.

item.title: Couple Missionaries: Blessings from Sacrifice and Service
item.description: Your Heavenly Father needs you. His work, under the direction of our Savior Jesus Christ, needs what you are uniquely prepared to give.

item.title: Preparations for the Restoration and the Second Coming: “My Hand Shall Be over Thee”
item.description: [The Lord’s] hand has been over the work of the Restoration from before the foundation of this world and will continue until His Second Coming.

item.title: To Act for Ourselves: The Gift and Blessings of Agency
item.description: Agency used righteously allows light to dispel the darkness and enables us to live with joy and happiness.

item.title: Holy Scriptures: The Power of God unto Our Salvation
item.description: Sacred records bear testimony of the Savior and lead us to Him.

item.title: To the Aaronic Priesthood: Preparing for the Decade of Decision
item.description: How you bear [the] priesthood now will prepare you to make the most important decisions in the future.

item.title: Personal Revelation: The Teachings and Examples of the Prophets
item.description: Personal revelation is the way we know for ourselves the most important truths of our existence.

item.title: Gaining a Testimony of God the Father; His Son, Jesus Christ; and the Holy Ghost
item.description: What has been told to me … can be told to you by the Holy Spirit … according to your obedience and desires.

item.title: Christian Courage: The Price of Discipleship
item.description: Answering our accusers in the Savior’s way.

item.title: Becoming Provident Providers Temporally and Spiritually
item.description: When we live providently, we can provide for ourselves and our families and also follow the Savior’s example to serve and bless others.

item.title: Seeking to Know God, Our Heavenly Father, and His Son, Jesus Christ
item.description: The light of belief is within you, waiting to be awakened and intensified by the Spirit of God.

item.title: Our Duty to God: The Mission of Parents and Leaders to the Rising Generation
item.description: It is our imperative duty to help youth understand and believe the gospel in a deeply personal way.

item.title: Agency: Essential to the Plan of Life
item.description: Whenever we choose to come unto Christ, take His name upon us, and follow His servants, we progress along the path to eternal life.

item.title: Waiting upon the Lord: Thy Will Be Done
item.description: The purpose of our life on earth is to grow, develop, and be strengthened through our own experiences.

item.title: Coming to Ourselves: The Sacrament, the Temple, and Sacrifice in Service
item.description: We become converted and spiritually self-reliant as we prayerfully live our covenants.

item.title: Being a More Christian Christian
item.description: This is the call of Christ to every Christian today: “Feed my lambs. … Feed my sheep.”

item.title: Stand Strong in Holy Places
item.description: Standing obedient and strong on the doctrine of our God, we stand in holy places, for His doctrine is sacred and will not change.

item.title: General Conference: Strengthening Faith and Testimony
item.description: Oh, how we need general conference! Through conferences our faith is fortified and our testimonies deepened.

item.title: “If Ye Love Me, Keep My Commandments”
item.description: Robert D. Hales teaches of the blessings that come when we use our agency to obey God's commandments, as the Savior Jesus Christ did.

item.title: Eternal Life—to Know Our Heavenly Father and His Son, Jesus Christ
item.description: Using many scriptures, Robert D. Hales teaches that the Father and Son are separate beings and that we can gain a testimony of Them.

item.title: Preserving Agency, Protecting Religious Freedom
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales explains why religious freedom is necessary for us to exercise agency and fulfill Heavenly Father’s plan.

item.title: Meeting the Challenges of Today’s World
item.description: Elder Hales instructs young adults to make wise choices concerning education, marriage, and Church service as they plan for their future.

item.title: The Holy Ghost
“Come, Follow Me” by Practicing Christian Love and Service
item.description: Elder Hales encourages followers of Jesus Christ to replace contention with Christlike love and kindness, which will help reduce spiritual suffering.

item.title: Becoming a Disciple of Our Lord Jesus Christ
item.description: Elder Hales teaches us about the interwoven characteristics that are all necessary to our becoming true disciples of Jesus Christ.
